isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - NOZZLES - DISASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: DISASSEMBLY

note.para: Disassemble only those nozzle holder assemblies that fail to meet specifications.

svcproc.para: When inspecting various components, reference can be made to test performance results as an aid in determining the extent of reconditioning necessary.

note.para: Under no circumstances should nozzle valves and bodies be interchanged. To avoid interchanging, use numbered containers to keep nozzle components together.

step1.para: Wash all external dirt, grease and carbon deposits from holder assembly with a suitable cleaning agent.
Remove nozzle gasket from nozzle, if not removed earlier.
A brass wire hand brush should be used to remove hardened deposits of dirt or carbon. DO NOT use a steel wire brush to clean the nozzles. Never use a power operated brush.

note.para: SOAK NOZZLE HOLDER ASSEMBLY IN A CARBON REMOVING CLEANING AGENT (GUNK, BENDIX CLEANER OR EQUIVALENT) FOR AT LEAST FOUR HOURS BEFORE REMOVING NOZZLE CAP NUT, OTHERWISE, THE NOZZLE PLATE PINS MAY BE DAMAGED.

step1.para: An SE-2752 injector nozzle holding fixture and SE-2753 injector nozzle clamping plate is required when disassembling a nozzle holder assembly; otherwise, the nozzle plate pins may be damaged.

step2.para: It is recommended that the SE-2752 holding fixture be bolted to a workbench.

Assemble the clamping plate SE-2753 to the guide pins on the holding fixture SE-2752. Refer to Figure 12.9
.

Insert the nozzle and holder assembly into the clamping plate as shown in Figure 12.9
.
Loosen the nozzle cap nut with an appropriate box end wrench until the nut can be turned by hand.

note.para: Wrench must be assembled prior to clamping nozzle in fixture.

step1.para:
The nozzle may now be disassembled. Refer to Figure 12.1
for component parts.

figure.caption: Figure 12.9. Mount Nozzle in Holding Fixture to Disassemble.
